abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            while project sustainability is likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are assessed as satisfactory. These
            are the lessons learned: Strong and continued
            Borrower's commitment to the project objectives during
            preparation and implementation are critical to successful
            implementation of technical assistance projects. The
            Borrower's commitment should also be obtained for using
            the credit funds for financing TA if the Credit is made
            available. It is valuable to coordinate the Bank-supported
            reform agenda with the content and timing of donor
            assistance. Ideally, donor coordination should be maintained
            throughout project implementation. The project
            implementation unit (PIU) plays a key role in the success of
            the project. the PIU's financial management and
            procurement and reporting capacity should be reviewed and
            strengthened during project preparation so that the PIU can
            begin implementation immediately after effectiveness. If an
            implementation support TA project continues after completion
            of the related adjustment operations, the Bank and the
            Borrower should continue the dialogue on the sector
            developments and monitor that the former funds will be used
            efficiently to continue the support, to sustain the outcomes
            of the reform aagenda, and to respond to new development
            needs. TA loans should be flexible (funding could be
            indicated in the legal agreement not by components, but by
            disbursement categories).
